review: Edit: 9/17/13Unfortunately I had to return it. (Lowered my rating from 3 to 1 star). Even though it was working last night after 4+ hours of trying. I woke up this morning and it was not working again. The router is 5 feet away from it. It is unreliable and cannot always connect to the internet. FYI, I am pretty familiar with networks and I'm not a novice. This thing is not ready for prime time.9/16/13I spent several hours trying to make the Chromecast work with my network. Chromecast has compatibility issues with several routers. This thing was driving me crazy! I was able to connect it to my network but not the internet.You need to go to Google support here: [...] and check known issues with several routers and workarounds.My router is the Netgear R6300, and In my case, I had to enable ipv6 in the router. (it is disabled by default)I noticed that many people were having similar issue; so I hope this resolves your connectivity problems and help keep your blood pressure down.

author: David Evans

review: $35 for streaming tv in HD, you could not have dreamed up anything better. I purchased this device thinking only about the potential and future apps. I currently own 2 Rokus, 2 Smart Bluray players, 1 Apple TV, 1 Smart TV not to mention 3 iPads, 2 iPhones,1 Xbox and 1 Wii all with streaming. I like because I save money on streaming  and I'm a big tech head too. The Google Chromecast has potential in the future to offer mirroring, games and more. So depending on what released in the coming months I plan to purchase at least 3 more of these.
author: Ant

review: I purchased this device primarily to stream live video and YouTube videos using my Cisco Linksys E3200 wifi router and Samsung 46" High Definition TV. I am very pleased with my abilities to stream a 2-hour weekly live video of a church service that broadcasts each Sunday morning via a LiveStream channel. I first tried using the Chrome browser on my Windows 7 HP laptop and after about an hour the quality began to degrade. But when I used the Chrome browser on my Windows 7 HP desktop I had no problems at all with the HD live stream. For that reason, I give this device five stars. My rating is because the device does a great job doing what I need it to do. Also the folks at Google chromecast were great when I had technical questions about the initial set-up with my router.
author: Carolina Tarheel

review: It's okay. It works well with Youtube and Netflix, but that's it. I hope it gets more apps. But I really hope the casting from the Chrome extension comes out of beta soon. I tried casting regular sites with video through my Macbook Pro, and though it's an old Mac and I only have Lion, it works well but does not seem to place nice with the Chromecast. The video is black and you can only hear sound. I tried casting with my husband's PC, and it works but there's still still hiccups and sync issues with video and sound that just ends up being a headache if you get invested in anything. I tried everything, changing the resolution and streaming to a low setting, didn't seem to improve it. I keep waiting for them to get more apps and to have better casting from the Chrome browser. I read online that a lot of people had better luck with this; I didn't because well I can't afford the new computers. I have my old Mac which doesn't really work well with this device.
